description:
Slices of roast pig, with a melty fatty layer between the crispy (brittle) skin and the tender meat.

**Characters**

{烤乳豬} is *roast suckling pig*.

In Hong Kong, as in places like Hawaii and the Philippines, [Spam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spam_(food)) (and its generic knockoffs known in English as *luncheon meat*) became popular after World War II and was integrated into the local cuisine, particularly in [cha chaan teng](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cha_chaan_teng) dishes, such as sandwiches, spam fried rice, spam ramen, macaroni and spam...

**Characters**

{午餐} is *lunch*, and {肉} is *meat*, so {午餐肉} is *lunch meat*.

{午} is *noon* and {餐} is *meal*, so {午餐} lunch is *noon meal*. Similarly, {早} is *early*, so {早餐} is *early meal*, i.e. breakfast.
